website_summaries.verdict: A compact, no-frills pneumatic die grinder that can get the job done and is available at a fraction of the cost of other brands.
pros: Neiko's die grinder is built to be a bargain
It turns on and off with a rudimentary yet functional throttle lever, has front exhaust, and features a narrow body so you can access tight spaces
cons: Because it is a basic tool, there is no safety feature to prevent the unit from accidentally turning on, so care must be used when setting the die grinder down

customer_reviews.title: A great little grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is a little powerhouse! I ran 3M Roloc discs on this for 30 minutes straight, stopping only long enough to drip a few more drops of oil in and change pads. It took it like a champ. It got warm, but never super hot. The size is incredible, too. It's out in the garage, so I don't have a measurement, but it can't be more than 5" long and 1.5" wide. It's truly tiny. The exhaust comes out toward the tip, which does work to keep the area clean, as others have commented.
customer_reviews.author: ihsan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap collet...
customer_reviews.text: It's a fine little tool, but the collet is junk. I had the bit come out of the tool twice while using it with what I considered more than adequate tightening. After really putting the squeeze on the collett, the bit held but it would not loosen with the provided "wrenches." This is going back.
customer_reviews.author: ADT944

customer_reviews.title: Seems Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for a large 4" grinder that died. I really only used it to cut rusted bolts so I thought this would fit the job better and be easier to handle. Whenever I use this I'll be wearing a face shield. The thought of the cutting wheel blowing apart is a real possibility. I rated it four stars since I don't know how long it will last. If I get three or more years out of it I'll change the rating. Too bad there isn't some type of guard for protection.
customer_reviews.author: Gramps

customer_reviews.title: Very cool little tool!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty awesome little air grinder. I paired it with some Forney 1/4" shank grinding heads and it works pretty good for applications where space is tight. It works okay off of my 6 gallon pancake compressor, but it does take a lot of air for extended grinding. I am thinking of getting a bigger compressor, but for now my 6 gallon works fine.
customer_reviews.author: BlackDogTX

customer_reviews.title: GET THIS NOW!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic value! This little grinder is perfect for small jobs, and possibly large ones too. It's the perfect size and weight! Well made, the inner mechanics and housing convey that this is a much more expensive product. Grab it as a go-to air tool, or at least as an inexpensive backup! Only possible downside is that it's non-adjustable, i.e., one speed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Scott

customer_reviews.title: About as small as they come
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is great. Smooth running. I used it with a cut off wheel a couple of times and it had enough power to cut through the bolts without any effort. I use it mostly with a carbide burr and I like the front exhaust because it helps keep the carbide cool and blows the chips away. I don't like using it in a corner though because then the metal chips just blow back at me. Has enough power for its size. No trigger safety so it can take off if not careful.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Great paperweight!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Unfortunately I leaned the hard way! Dont waste your money and buy a quality product that works. Tools provided are trash.
customer_reviews.author: Taras

customer_reviews.title: Nice little die grinder
customer_reviews.text: It's slightly smaller than I thought, but it's comfortable to use. The air vents through the front, pushing chips away from you. I highly recommend giving it a good oiling before use and run it up gradually to break it in. Then add more oil and use it.
customer_reviews.author: LoWang

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but not what I thought it was.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly to clean gasket surfaces with a roloc bristle disk, but makes it difficult to do so with only one speed. I didn't realize this wan't a variable speed air tool, it is either full speed or not. This won't be any good for what I am trying to do with it. Does work fine, but only if you want it at full speed.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: good tool
customer_reviews.text: a very good tool.it seems well made and should be good for home use. just remember to oil before use.
customer_reviews.author: D.Trump

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: Works great. no problems no complaints. used it with a wire brush, it was quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: joel trevino

customer_reviews.title: Very good tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price...turned them into Air Router's for a fraction of the price. The bases I bought were 5x the cost of the tool, and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Vail

customer_reviews.title: nice tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: The one I received works well. came with a tool schematic, i'm guessing to aid service. This does not come with any airline fittings.
customer_reviews.author: Linas Zukauskas

customer_reviews.title: Nice little unit
customer_reviews.text: Small and works great. Fairly easy to control speed by trigger pressure. It seems solid, and should last. It doesnt appear to use a lot of air.
customer_reviews.author: Tim B

customer_reviews.title: ... a gift to my son and he is very pleased with it and uses it daily in his work
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift to my son and he is very pleased with it and uses it daily in his work. A real deal!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Tiny grinder
customer_reviews.text: This die grinder is a lot smaller than Harbor Freight grinder with way more power. Nice quality and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I literally laughed at it's size, but man, she's a screamer! I bought one from Harbor Freight, and it was pathetically weak. This SMOKES their cheap one and, if it lasts, I'll be 110% happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Podhorn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: It should be dead after what I put it through. Great tool at this price.
customer_reviews.author: W.Ross

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat
customer_reviews.text: Ive used this many times and it works great. You will not find a better tool at a better price.
customer_reviews.author: solitude

customer_reviews.title: Does small jobs well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Good for occasional use. I suspect it won’t last long under heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Saad Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Only used a few times, but it worked rally great.
customer_reviews.author: Deep Diver

customer_reviews.title: Great little die grinder for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great little die grinder for the money. Used for home garage car repairs and other projects. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Nice and compact
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little tool, cuts/grinds with plenty of power. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: soaringhawk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grinder for tight spaces.
customer_reviews.text: Great power for the size. I love the compact size and front exhaust.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder
customer_reviews.text: Small but powerful. Uses a lot of air so you better have a good compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but packs a huge punch!
customer_reviews.text: As a welder I use this on a regular basis. For the money you can't beat it! Once it completely disintegrated on me and I put it back together and actually works better than before. Would still recommend
customer_reviews.author: sarah daigle

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well for a cheap die grinder
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well for a cheap die grinder. I give it 4/5 because the plastic end cap kept falling out of the body. I might have to glue it back on
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Way better than Harbor Freight for almost the same price. I've been using it with a cut off wheel and I am impressed with the performance. I am a tool and die machinist. I abuse grinders.
customer_reviews.author: Reed Miner

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Has the right feel and the right touch for RPM adjustment. Durability is still to be determined.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID DUBAY

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, works great, very good tool !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Tener

customer_reviews.title: I love this little thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing. I do auto body and have to grind welds in confined areas at times. It works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Good product so far.
customer_reviews.text: Only used it for one project, but for the money it is great!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Mast

customer_reviews.title: Grinders chuck is suspect.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I changed out a bit, the grinders chuck was so tight I bent the flimsy wrenches that came with the tool. I had to put the grinder in a vice and use a long handled wrench to break it free and now I don't have any confidence in the chuck.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Small package, lots of torque and very well balanced internals. No vibrations at all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Cant go wrong for the money. Nice tool. Has plenty of power. Small and easy to operate. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrneg9

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Has more power and uses less air than my old one.
customer_reviews.author: R@dio23

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Was perfect for the job it was intended. Just keep it oiled has worked flawless
customer_reviews.author: carl

customer_reviews.title: A welders best friend
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful and low profile!!! I got 3 of them
customer_reviews.author: sergio garcia

customer_reviews.title: excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: amazon has fantastic values, i shop amazon as often as i can and i highly recommend to all. my husband ordered this and is very pleased
customer_reviews.author: turtle

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this die grinder heavily for about a month now, and it has worked great thus far. I couldn't be happier. Combine it with a carbide bur, and it cuts through aluminum like butter. Add a cut-off wheel, and working with sheet metal is a snap. Just make sure to follow the instructions... it definitely seems to work best when oiled lightly and with air pressure regulated to 90 psi.
customer_reviews.author: Billy White

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Small and powerful. Could use a small regulator to slow it down
customer_reviews.author: KC taylor

product_meta.title: Neiko 30062A 1/4" Air Die Grinder, 24,000 RPM Free Speed | Mini and Compact Size
product_meta.description: 1/4-Inch Mini Air Die Grinder with Rear exhaust, Free speed of 24,000rpm, and 90 psi air pressure: 90 psi.
feature_bullets: Motor operates at a powerful high free speed of 24,000 RPM for quick and efficient sanding finish
Front exhaust design includes vent slots to control direction of airflow to prevent harmful dust from reaching operator
Small, compact body weighs in under a pound for an easy one hand operation and eliminating chance of hand fatigue
Simple touch lever flipper allows precision of the speed to apply to multiple applications such as welding, cutting, and polishing surfaces
Condense body size with a 1/4-inch collet fits great in tight narrow spaces in which an angled grinder cannot reach

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars128 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
